original: 如是乃至一切智不可取故無染污，一切智無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨；
analyzed: 如是乃至一切智不可取故無染污，一切智無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨；
translated: In the same way, up to: because omniscience is ungraspable, it is undefiled. Because omniscience is undefiled, prajñā-pāramitā is pure;

original: 道相智、一切相智不可取故無染污，道相智、一切相智無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 道相智、一切相智不可取故無染污，道相智、一切相智無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: because the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects are ungraspable, they are undefiled. Because the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of all aspects are undefiled, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space is undefiled, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
World-Honored One!

original: 云何虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
analyzed: 云何虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
translated: How is it that because space is undefiled, prajñā-pāramitā is pure?
Subhūti!

original: 虛空不可取故無染污，虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空不可取故無染污，虛空無染污故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space is ungraspable, it is undefiled. Because space is undefiled, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 虛空唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space is only a provisional designation, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
World-Honored One!

original: 云何虛空唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
analyzed: 云何虛空唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
translated: How is it that because space is only a provisional designation, prajñā-pāramitā is pure?
Subhūti!

original: 如依虛空二響聲現唯有假說，唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 如依虛空二響聲現唯有假說，唯假說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space is only a provisional designation, like two echoes in space, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 虛空不可說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空不可說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space is indescribable, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
World-Honored One!

original: 云何虛空不可說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
analyzed: 云何虛空不可說故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
translated: How is it that because space is inexpressible, prajñā-pāramitā is pure?
Subhūti!

original: 虛空無可說事故不可說，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空無可說事故不可說，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space has nothing to be expressed, it is inexpressible. For this reason, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 虛空不可得故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空不可得故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space cannot be attained, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
World-Honored One!

original: 云何虛空不可得故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
analyzed: 云何虛空不可得故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
translated: How is it that because space cannot be attained, prajñā-pāramitā is pure?
Subhūti!

original: 虛空無可得事故不可得，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 虛空無可得事故不可得，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because space has nothing to be attained, it cannot be attained. For this reason, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 一切法無生無滅、無染無淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 一切法無生無滅、無染無淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because all dharmas are unborn, unceasing, unstained, and unpurified, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
World-Honored One!

original: 云何一切法無生無滅、無染無淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
analyzed: 云何一切法無生無滅、無染無淨故，般若波羅蜜多清淨？
translated: How is it that because all dharmas are unborn, unceasing, unstained, and unpurified, prajñā-pāramitā is pure?
Subhūti!

original: 以一切法畢竟淨故無生無滅、無染無淨，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
analyzed: 以一切法畢竟淨故無生無滅、無染無淨，由此般若波羅蜜多清淨。
translated: Because all dharmas are ultimately pure, they are without arising and without cessation, without defilement and without purity. For this reason, prajñā-pāramitā is pure.
At that time, Subhūti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

original: 若善男子、善女人等於此般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、書寫、解說、廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等眼、耳、鼻、舌皆無所患，身支無缺不甚衰耄亦不橫死，常為無量百千天神恭敬圍繞隨逐衛護。
analyzed: 若善男子、善女人等於此般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精勤修學、如理思惟、書寫、解說、廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等眼、耳、鼻、舌皆無所患，身支無缺不甚衰耄亦不橫死，常為無量百千天神恭敬圍繞隨逐衛護。
translated: If good sons and good women sincerely listen to, uphold, recite, diligently practice, contemplate according to the principles, copy, explain, and widely disseminate this prajñā-pāramitā, these good sons and good women will have no problems with their eyes, ears, nose, or tongue. Their limbs will be complete, they will not be extremely decrepit, and they will not die an untimely death. They will always be respectfully surrounded and followed by innumerable hundreds of thousands of celestial beings who will guard and protect them.

original: 是善男子、善女人等於黑白月各第八日、第十四日、第十五日，讀誦、宣說如是般若波羅蜜多，是時四大王眾天乃至淨居天，皆來集會此法師所，聽受般若波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 是善男子、善女人等於黑白月各第八日、第十四日、第十五日，讀誦、宣說如是般若波羅蜜多，是時四大王眾天乃至淨居天，皆來集會此法師所，聽受般若波羅蜜多。
translated: These good men and good women, on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of each dark and bright month, recite and expound this prajñā-pāramitā. At that time, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings up to the Heaven of Pure Abode will all come to gather at the place of this Dharma teacher to listen to and accept the prajñā-pāramitā.

original: 是善男子、善女人等由於無量大集會中，讀誦、宣說甚深般若波羅蜜多，便獲無量無數無邊不可思議不可稱量殊勝功德。
analyzed: 是善男子、善女人等由於無量大集會中，讀誦、宣說甚深般若波羅蜜多，便獲無量無數無邊不可思議不可稱量殊勝功德。
translated: These good men and good women, in the midst of immeasurable great assemblies, recite and expound the profound prajñā-pāramitā, and will thereby attain immeasurable, innumerable, boundless, inconceivable, and immeasurable supreme merits and virtues.
The Buddha told Subhūti:🔽So it is!
So it is, as you have said.

original: 若善男子、善女人等於此般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精進修學、如理思惟、書寫、解說、廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等眼、耳、鼻、舌皆無所患身支無缺，不甚衰耄亦無橫死，常為無量百千天神恭敬圍遶隨逐衛護。
analyzed: 若善男子、善女人等於此般若波羅蜜多，至心聽聞、受持、讀誦、精進修學、如理思惟、書寫、解說、廣令流布，是善男子、善女人等眼、耳、鼻、舌皆無所患身支無缺，不甚衰耄亦無橫死，常為無量百千天神恭敬圍遶隨逐衛護。
translated: If good men and good women sincerely listen to, uphold, recite, diligently practice, contemplate according to the principles, copy, explain, and widely disseminate this prajñā-pāramitā, these good men and good women will have no problems with their eyes, ears, nose, or tongue, their limbs will be complete, they will not be greatly decrepit or die an untimely death, and they will always be respectfully surrounded and followed by innumerable hundreds of thousands of celestial beings who will protect them.

original: 是善男子、善女人等於六齋日讀誦、宣說如是般若波羅蜜多，是時四大王眾天乃至淨居天，皆來集會此法師所，聽受般若波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 是善男子、善女人等於六齋日讀誦、宣說如是般若波羅蜜多，是時四大王眾天乃至淨居天，皆來集會此法師所，聽受般若波羅蜜多。
translated: On the six observance days, if these good men and good women recite and expound this prajñā-pāramitā, then the celestial beings of the Four Heavenly Kings up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods will all come to the place of this Dharma teacher to listen to and receive the prajñā-pāramitā.

original: 是善男子、善女人等由於無量大集會中讀誦、宣說甚深般若波羅蜜多，便獲無量無數無邊不可思議不可稱量殊勝功德。
analyzed: 是善男子、善女人等由於無量大集會中讀誦、宣說甚深般若波羅蜜多，便獲無量無數無邊不可思議不可稱量殊勝功德。
translated: These good men and good women, in immeasurable great assemblies, by reading, reciting, and expounding the profound prajñā-pāramitā, will attain immeasurable, innumerable, boundless, inconceivable, and immeasurable supreme merits and virtues.
Why is this?
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是大珍寶，由此般若波羅蜜多大珍寶故，無量無數無邊有情解脫地獄、傍生、鬼界，及令無量無數無邊天、龍、藥叉、人非人等，解脫種種貧窮苦患。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是大珍寶，由此般若波羅蜜多大珍寶故，無量無數無邊有情解脫地獄、傍生、鬼界，及令無量無數無邊天、龍、藥叉、人非人等，解脫種種貧窮苦患。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is a great precious treasure. Because of this great precious treasure of prajñā-pāramitā, immeasurable, innumerable, boundless sentient beings are liberated from the hells, animal realms, and the realm of hungry ghosts, and it causes immeasurable, innumerable, boundless gods, dragons, yakṣas, humans, and non-humans to be liberated from various sufferings of poverty.

original: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，剎帝利大族、婆羅門大族、長者大族、居士大族富貴安樂；
analyzed: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，剎帝利大族、婆羅門大族、長者大族、居士大族富貴安樂；
translated: It is able to bestow upon immeasurable, innumerable, boundless sentient beings the affluence, comfort, and happiness of the great clans of kṣatriyas, the great clans of brahmins, the great clans of householders, and the great clans of citizens;

original: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，四大王眾天乃至非想非非想處天富貴安樂；
analyzed: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，四大王眾天乃至非想非非想處天富貴安樂；
translated: It can bestow the noble and blissful states of the Catur-mahâ-râja-kāyika gods up to the naivasaṃjñānâsaṃjñā-āyatana gods to innumerable, limitless, and boundless sentient beings;

original: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，預流、一來、不還、阿羅漢果、獨覺菩提及與無上正等菩提自在安樂。
analyzed: 能施無量無數無邊諸有情類，預流、一來、不還、阿羅漢果、獨覺菩提及與無上正等菩提自在安樂。
translated: It can bestow the self-mastery and bliss of the fruits of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship, the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha, and supreme perfect enlightenment to innumerable, limitless, and boundless sentient beings.
Why is it so?
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多甚深經中，廣說開示十善業道，四靜慮、四無量、四無色定，四念住乃至八聖道支，布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多，內空乃至無性自性空，如來十力乃至十八佛不共法，一切智、道相智、一切相智。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多甚深經中，廣說開示十善業道，四靜慮、四無量、四無色定，四念住乃至八聖道支，布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多，內空乃至無性自性空，如來十力乃至十八佛不共法，一切智、道相智、一切相智。
translated: In this profound sutra of prajñā-pāramitā, the ten wholesome courses of action, the four concentrations, the four immeasurable [minds], the four formless concentrations, the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path, the pāramitā of giving up to the pāramitā of wisdom, the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existent phenomena, the ten powers of the Tathāgata up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects are extensively explained and revealed.

original: 如是無量功德珍寶，無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得生剎帝利大族、婆羅門大族、長者大族、居士大族；
analyzed: 如是無量功德珍寶，無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得生剎帝利大族、婆羅門大族、長者大族、居士大族；
translated: In this way, countless precious virtues, countless, innumerable, and boundless sentient beings cultivate and learn in them, and are born in the great clans of kṣatriyas, brahmins, householders, and citizens;

original: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得生四大王眾天乃至非想非非想處天；
analyzed: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得生四大王眾天乃至非想非非想處天；
translated: countless, innumerable, and boundless sentient beings cultivate and learn in them, and are born as the four heavenly kings, up to the heaven of neither perception nor non-perception;

original: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得預流果、一來、不還、阿羅漢果；
analyzed: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得預流果、一來、不還、阿羅漢果；
translated: countless, innumerable, and boundless sentient beings cultivate and learn in them, and attain the fruit of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and arhatship;

original: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得獨覺菩提；
analyzed: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得獨覺菩提；
translated: countless, innumerable, and boundless sentient beings cultivate and learn in them, and attain pratyekabuddha enlightenment;

original: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得入菩薩正性離生，證得無上正等菩提。
analyzed: 無量無數無邊有情於中修學，得入菩薩正性離生，證得無上正等菩提。
translated: countless, innumerable, and boundless sentient beings cultivate and learn in them, enter the certainty of the bodhisattvas, and attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
Subhūti!

original: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名大寶藏，世出世間功德珍寶皆依如是甚深般若波羅蜜多而出現故。
analyzed: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名大寶藏，世出世間功德珍寶皆依如是甚深般若波羅蜜多而出現故。
translated: For this reason, this prajñā-pāramitā is called the great treasure storehouse. The precious treasures of merits and virtues, both mundane and supramundane, all appear based on this profound prajñā-pāramitā.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說少法有生有滅、有染有淨、有取有捨。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說少法有生有滅、有染有淨、有取有捨。
translated: In this great treasure storehouse of prajñā-pāramitā, it is said that no dharma has arising, ceasing, defilement, purity, grasping, or letting go.
Why is it so?
Subhūti!

original: 以無少法可生可滅、可染可淨、可取捨故。
analyzed: 以無少法可生可滅、可染可淨、可取捨故。
translated: Because there are no dharmas that can arise, cease, be defiled, be purified, be grasped, or be let go.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說有法是善是非善、是有記是無記、是世間是出世間、是有漏是無漏、是有為是無為。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說有法是善是非善、是有記是無記、是世間是出世間、是有漏是無漏、是有為是無為。
translated: In this great treasure storehouse of prajñā-pāramitā, it is said that there are no dharmas that are good or not good, that have karmic retributions or do not have karmic retributions, that are mundane or supramundane, that are with outflows or without outflows, that are conditioned or unconditioned.
Subhūti!

original: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名無所得大法寶藏。
analyzed: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名無所得大法寶藏。
translated: For this reason, this prajñā-pāramitā is called the great treasure storehouse of the Dharma that cannot be attained.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說少法是能染污。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多大寶藏中，不說少法是能染污。
translated: In this great treasure of prajñā-pāramitā, no dharmas are said to be defiled.
Why is it so?

original: 以無少法可染污故，亦無少法能染如是甚深般若波羅蜜多大法寶藏。
analyzed: 以無少法可染污故，亦無少法能染如是甚深般若波羅蜜多大法寶藏。
translated: Because there are no dharmas that can be defiled, and there are also no dharmas that can defile this great treasure of the profound Dharma of prajñā-pāramitā.
Why is it so?
Because the dharmas that can defile cannot be found.
Subhūti!

original: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名無染污大法寶藏。
analyzed: 由此因緣，如是般若波羅蜜多名無染污大法寶藏。
translated: For this reason, this prajñā-pāramitā is called the great treasure of the undefiled Dharma.
Furthermore, Subhūti!

original: 若菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，無如是想、如是分別、如是有得、如是戲論：
analyzed: 若菩薩摩訶薩修行般若波羅蜜多時，無如是想、如是分別、如是有得、如是戲論：
translated: If bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, when practicing prajñā-pāramitā, have such thoughts, such discriminations, such attainments, such frivolous arguments, thinking:

original: 『我能修行甚深般若波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 『我能修行甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translated: 'I can practice the profound prajñā-pāramitā.'

original: 』是菩薩摩訶薩能如實修行甚深般若波羅蜜多，亦能親近禮事諸佛，從一佛國至一佛國，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊，遊諸佛國善取其相，嚴淨佛土、成熟有情，修諸菩薩摩訶薩行，疾證無上正等菩提。
analyzed: 』是菩薩摩訶薩能如實修行甚深般若波羅蜜多，亦能親近禮事諸佛，從一佛國至一佛國，供養恭敬、尊重讚歎諸佛世尊，遊諸佛國善取其相，嚴淨佛土、成熟有情，修諸菩薩摩訶薩行，疾證無上正等菩提。
translated: This bodhisattva-mahāsattva is able to practice the profound prajñā-pāramitā in accordance with reality, and is also able to approach and serve the buddhas, going from one buddha land to another buddha land, making offerings and paying homage to the buddhas, the world-honored ones, and praising them. He roams through the buddha lands, skillfully apprehending their characteristics, purifying buddha lands and bringing sentient beings to maturity, cultivating the practices of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, and quickly realizing supreme perfect enlightenment.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法，非有自在，非無自在，不取不捨、不生不滅、不垢不淨、不增不減。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法，非有自在，非無自在，不取不捨、不生不滅、不垢不淨、不增不減。
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā has no mastery over any dharmas, nor is it without mastery. It does not grasp or abandon, does not arise or cease, is not defiled or pure, and does not increase or decrease.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多，非過去、非未來、非現在，不趣欲界、不捨欲界、不住欲界，不趣色界、不捨色界、不住色界，不趣無色界、不捨無色界、不住無色界。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多，非過去、非未來、非現在，不趣欲界、不捨欲界、不住欲界，不趣色界、不捨色界、不住色界，不趣無色界、不捨無色界、不住無色界。
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā is neither past, nor future, nor present, does not proceed to the desire realm, does not abandon the desire realm, does not abide in the desire realm, does not proceed to the form realm, does not abandon the form realm, does not abide in the form realm, does not proceed to the formless realm, does not abandon the formless realm, does not abide in the formless realm.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多，於布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多不與不捨；
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多，於布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多不與不捨；
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā does not give or abandon the perfections of giving, morality, patience, zeal, meditation, and wisdom;

original: 於內空乃至無性自性空亦不與、不捨；
analyzed: 於內空乃至無性自性空亦不與、不捨；
translated: it also does not give or abandon internal emptiness, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence;

original: 於四念住乃至八聖道支亦不與不捨；
analyzed: 於四念住乃至八聖道支亦不與不捨；
translated: it also does not give or abandon the four mindfulnesses, up to the eightfold noble path;

original: 於如來十力乃至十八佛不共法亦不與不捨；🔽於預流果乃至獨覺菩提亦不與不捨；
analyzed: 於如來十力乃至十八佛不共法亦不與不捨； 於預流果乃至獨覺菩提亦不與不捨；
translated: it also does not give or abandon the ten powers of the Tathāgata, up to the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha;🔽it also does not give or abandon the fruit of the stream-enterer, up to the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha;

original: 於諸菩薩正性離生乃至無上正等菩提亦不與不捨；
analyzed: 於諸菩薩正性離生乃至無上正等菩提亦不與不捨；
translated: it also does not give or abandon the correct liberation of the bodhisattvas, up to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment;

original: 於一切智、道相智、一切相智亦不與不捨。
analyzed: 於一切智、道相智、一切相智亦不與不捨。
translated: It neither associates with nor disassociates from the cognition of all modes, nor does it associate with or disassociate from the cognition of all aspects.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多，於異生法不與不捨；
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多，於異生法不與不捨；
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of ordinary beings;

original: 於預流法乃至阿羅漢法不與不捨；
analyzed: 於預流法乃至阿羅漢法不與不捨；
translated: It neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of stream-enterers up to arhats;
It neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas;
It neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of bodhisattvas;
It neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of buddhas.
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多，不與聲聞法、不捨異生法，不與獨覺法、不捨聲聞法，不與諸佛法、不捨獨覺法，不與無為法、不捨有為法。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多，不與聲聞法、不捨異生法，不與獨覺法、不捨聲聞法，不與諸佛法、不捨獨覺法，不與無為法、不捨有為法。
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā neither associates with the dharmas of śrāvakas nor disassociates from the dharmas of ordinary beings, it neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas, it neither associates with nor disassociates from the dharmas of buddhas, it neither associates with nor disassociates from conditioned dharmas.
Why is it so?
Subhūti!

original: 如來出世若不出世，如是諸法常無變易，法性、法界、法定、法住無謬失故。
analyzed: 如來出世若不出世，如是諸法常無變易，法性、法界、法定、法住無謬失故。
translated: Whether the Tathāgata appears in the world or not, these dharmas are always without change. The nature of dharmas, the realm of dharmas, the determination of dharmas, the abiding of dharmas is without error or loss.

original: 」爾時，無量百千天子住虛空中歡喜踊躍，以天所有嗢鉢羅花、鉢特摩花、拘某陀花、奔荼利花、微妙音花及諸香末而散佛上，更相慶慰同聲唱言：
analyzed: 」爾時，無量百千天子住虛空中歡喜踊躍，以天所有嗢鉢羅花、鉢特摩花、拘某陀花、奔荼利花、微妙音花及諸香末而散佛上，更相慶慰同聲唱言：
translated: At that time, countless hundreds of thousands of gods dwelling in the sky joyfully exclaimed, scattering heavenly utpala flowers, pāṭala flowers, kumuda flowers, and mandāra flowers, as well as various fragrant powders over the Buddha, and in mutual celebration they exclaimed in unison:

original: 「我等今者於贍部洲，見佛第二轉妙法輪。
analyzed: 「我等今者於贍部洲，見佛第二轉妙法輪。
translated: We now see the Buddha turning the wonderful Dharma wheel for the second time in Jambudvīpa.

original: 」此中無量百千天子聞說般若波羅蜜多，同時證得無生法忍。
analyzed: 」此中無量百千天子聞說般若波羅蜜多，同時證得無生法忍。
translated: Here, countless hundreds of thousands of gods, having heard the teaching of prajñā-pāramitā, simultaneously attained the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas.
At that time, the World-Honored One told Subhūti:

original: 「如是法輪非第一轉，亦非第二。
analyzed: 「如是法輪非第一轉，亦非第二。
translated: This Dharma wheel is neither the first turning nor the second turning.
Why is it so?
Subhūti!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間，但以無性自性空故。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間，但以無性自性空故。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā does not appear in the world in order to turn or return all dharmas, but only because of the emptiness of inherent nature that is without inherent nature.
The Venerable Subhūti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

original: 以何等法無性自性空故？
analyzed: 以何等法無性自性空故？
translated: Due to the emptiness of intrinsic nature of what dharmas?

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間。
translated: Thus, this prajñā-pāramitā appears in the world not for the sake of turning [away from samsāra] or returning [to nirvāṇa] with regard to all dharmas.
The Buddha told Subhūti:

original: 「以般若波羅蜜多般若波羅蜜多性空故，乃至布施波羅蜜多布施波羅蜜多性空故；
analyzed: 「以般若波羅蜜多般若波羅蜜多性空故，乃至布施波羅蜜多布施波羅蜜多性空故；
translated: Because prajñā-pāramitā is empty of the intrinsic nature of prajñā-pāramitā, up to because giving-pāramitā is empty of the intrinsic nature of giving-pāramitā;

original: 以內空內空性空故，乃至無性自性空無性自性空性空故；
analyzed: 以內空內空性空故，乃至無性自性空無性自性空性空故；
translated: Because internal emptiness is empty of the intrinsic nature of internal emptiness, up to because the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence is empty of the intrinsic nature of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence;

original: 以四念住四念住性空故，乃至八聖道支八聖道支性空故；
analyzed: 以四念住四念住性空故，乃至八聖道支八聖道支性空故；
translated: Because the four establishments of mindfulness are empty of the intrinsic nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, up to because the eightfold noble path is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eightfold noble path;

original: 以如來十力如來十力性空故，乃至十八佛不共法十八佛不共法性空故；
analyzed: 以如來十力如來十力性空故，乃至十八佛不共法十八佛不共法性空故；
translated: Because the ten powers of the Tathāgata are empty of the intrinsic nature of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, up to because the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are empty of the intrinsic nature of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha;

original: 一切智一切智性空故，道相智、一切相智道相智、一切相智性空故；
analyzed: 一切智一切智性空故，道相智、一切相智道相智、一切相智性空故；
translated: because the nature of the cognition of the knowledge of path aspects and the cognition of all aspects is empty;

original: 異生性異生性性空故，預流果預流果性空故，乃至阿羅漢果阿羅漢果性空故，獨覺菩提獨覺菩提性空故；
analyzed: 異生性異生性性空故，預流果預流果性空故，乃至阿羅漢果阿羅漢果性空故，獨覺菩提獨覺菩提性空故；
translated: because the nature of the state of an ordinary being is empty, and the nature of the fruit of entering the stream, up to the nature of the fruit of arhatship is empty, and the nature of the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha is empty;

original: 一切菩薩摩訶薩行一切菩薩摩訶薩行性空故，諸佛無上正等菩提諸佛無上正等菩提性空故。
analyzed: 一切菩薩摩訶薩行一切菩薩摩訶薩行性空故，諸佛無上正等菩提諸佛無上正等菩提性空故。
translated: because the nature of the practice of all bodhisattva great beings is empty, and the nature of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas is empty.
Subhūti!

original: 以如是等法無性自性空故，如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間。
analyzed: 以如是等法無性自性空故，如是般若波羅蜜多於一切法不為轉故、不為還故出現世間。
translated: Because the nature of these dharmas is empty, this prajñā-pāramitā appears in the world not for the sake of turning back any dharmas, and not for the sake of returning.
At that time, the Venerable Subhūti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

original: 諸菩薩摩訶薩如是般若波羅蜜多，是大波羅蜜多達一切法自性空故。
analyzed: 諸菩薩摩訶薩如是般若波羅蜜多，是大波羅蜜多達一切法自性空故。
translated: The prajñā-pāramitā of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is a great pāramitā, because it penetrates the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas.

original: 雖達一切法自性皆空，而諸菩薩摩訶薩依此般若波羅蜜多證得無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪度無量眾。
analyzed: 雖達一切法自性皆空，而諸菩薩摩訶薩依此般若波羅蜜多證得無上正等菩提，轉妙法輪度無量眾。
translated: Although it penetrates the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas rely on this prajñā-pāramitā to realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and turn the sublime Dharma wheel to liberate innumerable beings.

original: 雖證菩提而無所證，證、不證法不可得故；
analyzed: 雖證菩提而無所證，證、不證法不可得故；
translated: Although they realize enlightenment, there is nothing to be realized, because the dharma of realization and non-realization cannot be obtained.

original: 雖轉法輪而無所轉，轉法、還法不可得故；
analyzed: 雖轉法輪而無所轉，轉法、還法不可得故；
translated: Although they turn the Dharma wheel, there is nothing to be turned, because the dharma of turning and returning cannot be obtained.

original: 雖度有情而無所度，見、不見法不可得故。
analyzed: 雖度有情而無所度，見、不見法不可得故。
translated: Although they liberate beings, there is no one to be liberated, because the dharma of seeing and not seeing cannot be obtained.
World-Honored One!

original: 於此大般若波羅蜜多中，轉法輪事都不可得，以一切法永不生故，能轉、所轉不可得故。
analyzed: 於此大般若波羅蜜多中，轉法輪事都不可得，以一切法永不生故，能轉、所轉不可得故。
translated: In this great prajñā-pāramitā, the matter of turning the Dharma wheel is utterly unobtainable, because all dharmas are eternally unborn, and that which can be turned and that which is turned cannot be obtained.
Why is it so?

original: 非空、無相、無願法中，可有能轉及能還法，轉還性法不可得故。
analyzed: 非空、無相、無願法中，可有能轉及能還法，轉還性法不可得故。
translated: In the Dharma of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, there is no dharma that can be turned or returned, because the nature of a dharma that is turned or returned cannot be obtained.
World-Honored One!

original: 於此般若波羅蜜多，若能如是宣說開示分別顯了令易悟入，是名善淨宣說般若波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 於此般若波羅蜜多，若能如是宣說開示分別顯了令易悟入，是名善淨宣說般若波羅蜜多。
translated: If one can thus expound, reveal, discriminate, and clearly understand this prajñā-pāramitā, it is called the well-purified expounding of prajñā-pāramitā.

original: 此中都無說者、受者、所說受法，既無說者、受者及法，諸能證者亦不可得，無證者故，亦無有能得涅槃者，於此般若波羅蜜多善說法中亦無福田，施受、施物皆性空故，福田無故福亦性空，摽幟名言皆不可得，是故名大波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 此中都無說者、受者、所說受法，既無說者、受者及法，諸能證者亦不可得，無證者故，亦無有能得涅槃者，於此般若波羅蜜多善說法中亦無福田，施受、施物皆性空故，福田無故福亦性空，摽幟名言皆不可得，是故名大波羅蜜多。
translated: Here, there is no expounder, no receiver, and no dharma that is expounded or received. Since there is no expounder, no receiver, and no dharma, the one who can realize it is also unobtainable. Because there is no realizer, there is also no one who can attain nirvāṇa. In this well-expounded Dharma of prajñā-pāramitā, there is also no field of merit, because the giver, the receiver, and the gift are all empty by nature. Because there is no field of merit, merit is also empty by nature. The names and words that are designated are all unobtainable. Therefore, it is called the great pāramitā.

original: 」42 不可得品第二分不可得品第四十二爾時，具壽善現復白佛言：
analyzed: 」42 不可得品第二分不可得品第四十二爾時，具壽善現復白佛言：
translated: Chapter 42: The Unattainable, Part 2, Chapter 42: The Unattainable At that time, Subhūti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無邊波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無邊波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the boundless pāramitā.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because space is boundless.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是平等波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是平等波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the equal pāramitā.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because the nature of all dharmas is equal.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是遠離波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是遠離波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the isolated pāramitā.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because of ultimate emptiness.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是難屈伏波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是難屈伏波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā that is difficult to subdue.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because the nature of all dharmas is ungraspable.🔽Here is the text with the alignment mistakes fixed and the English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無彼岸波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無彼岸波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā of the other shore.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because it has no name or substance.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是虛空波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是虛空波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā of space.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because inhalation and exhalation cannot be attained.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是不可說波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是不可說波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the inexpressible pāramitā.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because seeking and discernment cannot be attained here.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無名波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無名波羅蜜多。
translated: This prajñā-pāramitā is the nameless pāramitā.
The Buddha said:
So it is!

original: 受、想、思、觸及作意等不可得故。
analyzed: 受、想、思、觸及作意等不可得故。
translated: Because feeling, perception, volition, contact, and attention, etc. cannot be attained.
World-Honored One!

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無行波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無行波羅蜜多。
translated: Such prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā of non-action.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because all dharmas have no coming or going.
The Bodhisattva said:

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是不可奪波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是不可奪波羅蜜多。
translated: Such prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā that cannot be taken away.
The Buddha said:
So it is!
Because all dharmas are invincible.
The Bodhisattva said:

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無盡波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無盡波羅蜜多。
translated: Such prajñā-pāramitā is the pāramitā of inexhaustibility.
The Buddha said:
So it is!

original: 以一切法是畢竟盡不可盡故。
analyzed: 以一切法是畢竟盡不可盡故。
translated: Because all dharmas are ultimately exhausted and inexhaustible.
The Bodhisattva said:

original: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無生滅波羅蜜多。
analyzed: 如是般若波羅蜜多是無生滅波羅蜜多。
